replies.msg: Rabbits are prey animals which means they're everybody else's lunch in nature. A dog barking, a child shouting, an airplane roaring overhead, an ambulance siren wailing and a lightning storm can frighten rabbits. Therefore taking a rabbit on a leash isn't recommended. Indoor rabbits have a much longer lifespan than outdoor rabbits because they're protected from poor weather conditions and enemies. They feel safe, protected, monitored, sheltered and that they're part of the family. The average lifespan of an indoor house rabbits are eight to fourteen years whereas the average lifespan of a rabbit kept in an outdoor hutch and cage are three to six years. The happiest rabbit expression is called binky. When a rabbit binkies it jumps into the air and twists its head and body in the opposite direction before falling back to the ground. A happy rabbit even twirls, flops, shakes its head and stretches its legs. All these are telling you that it's happy and overall pleased with you and its life. Rabbits produce two types of pellets: fecal pellets and cecal pellets (aka cecotropes) The former are the dry round ones you usually see in the litterbox while the latter are edible for rabbits which contain essential nutrients. Rabbits are one of the most abandoned pets in the world. In fact it's the third most abandoned pets in the United states because so many people do not understand rabbits and think that rabbits are boring and that they don't bond with humans. Rabbits are highly intelligent social and affectionate animals. While they dont like to be picked up from the ground they'd much rather be cuddled and petted while they're on the ground or in your lap. When people say they want to have a pet rabbit I usually advise them to visit the rabbit society and choose a bunny for adoption.
